text: Suseok (수석) is the Korean term for small naturally occurring or shaped rocks which are traditionally valued. They are similar to Chinese scholar's rocks. Suseok can be any color. There are a wide variety of sizes. Suseok can weigh hundreds of pounds or less than one pound. The term also means stones which are placed in traditional Korean gardens. ==History== Chinese scholar's rocks influenced the development of suseok in Korea.Brokaw, Charles. (2011). The Temple Mount Code, p. 73. ==Evaluation== The evaluation of suseok recognizes color, shape, markings and surface. == Related pages == * Suiseki * Bonsai * Penjing * Standing stone ==References== ==Other websites== * Suseok at KoreanViewingStones.com via Internet Archive * Bucheon Museum of Suseok at Bucheon.go.kr Category:Korean culture
title: Suseok
